instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
Arrived with minor liquid damage. Fan spins and dvd drives activates but no chime and hard drive led light stays solid.

Liquid damage was on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R4650</RESISTOR>, and pin 6 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>

Replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R4650</RESISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>. All traces on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> are good along with <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>

CPU vcore 0.965v

Should something else be checked or sound like a dead CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
Do you get voltage on the other coils (RAM, PCH)?
Does it beep without any RAM module inserted?
Test with known good RAM module in each slot.
Check RAM slots with DDR3 test card.

VCORE should drop to 0.75V aprox in few seconds, when board boots.
Inspect SPI traces and resistors.
Try known good working BIOS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message: Tried known good bios and now it chimes but there are horizontal lines are on the screen?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
Probably bad display.
Did you test external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
Yes no video on external video.

no Apple logo on main display. Just lines. See picture. Also will not chime if battery is plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
Let the battery out, untill get working board.
Try another BIOS file...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message: I used clean me region bios file found on forum posted by you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message: Yes nothing loads. Just lines on the screen. External does not work. either Dead CPU or PCH? <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> had liquid damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post
threads.message:
You've probably wanted to say <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.
CPU could get damaged because of that...
